verses.verse: Now <S%G1161><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> the things whereof <S%G4012><s%> <S%G3739><s%> you wrote <S%G1125><s%> to me: It is good <S%G2570><s%> for a man <S%G444><s%> not to touch <S%G680><s%> a woman. <S%G1135><s%>

Nevertheless, <S%G1161><s%> to avoid <S%G1223><s%> fornication, <S%G4202><s%> let every <S%G1538><s%> man have <S%G2192><s%> his own <S%G1438><s%> wife, <S%G1135><s%> and let every <S%G1538><s%> woman have <S%G2192><s%> her own <S%G2398><s%> husband. <S%G435><s%>

Let the husband <S%G435><s%> render <S%G591><s%> to the wife <S%G1135><s%> due <S%G3784><s%> benevolence: <S%G2133><s%> and likewise <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> the wife <S%G1135><s%> to the husband. <S%G435><s%>

The wife <S%G1135><s%> has not power <S%G1850><s%> of her own <S%G2398><s%> body, <S%G4983><s%> but the husband: <S%G435><s%> and likewise <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> the husband <S%G435><s%> has not power <S%G1850><s%> of his own <S%G2398><s%> body, <S%G4983><s%> but the wife. <S%G1135><s%>

Defraud <S%G650><s%> you not one <S%G240><s%> the other, <S%G240><s%> except <S%G1509><s%> it be with consent <S%G4859><s%> for a time, <S%G2540><s%> that you may give <S%G4980><s%> yourselves to fasting <S%G3521><s%> and prayer; <S%G4335><s%> and come <S%G4905><s%> together <S%G1909><s%> again, <S%G3825><s%> that Satan <S%G4567><s%> tempt <S%G3985><s%> you not for your <S%G5216><s%> incontinency. <S%G192><s%>
But I speak <S%G3004><s%> this <S%G5124><s%> by permission, <S%G4774><s%> and not of commandment. <S%G2003><s%>

For I would <S%G2309><s%> that all <S%G3956><s%> men <S%G444><s%> were even <S%G2532><s%> as I myself. <S%G1683><s%> But every <S%G1538><s%> man has <S%G2192><s%> his proper <S%G2398><s%> gift <S%G5486><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> one <S%G3739><s%> <S%G3303><s%> after <S%G3779><s%> this <S%G3779><s%> manner, <S%G3779><s%> and another <S%G3588><s%> after <S%G3779><s%> that.
I say <S%G3004><s%> therefore <S%G1161><s%> to the unmarried <S%G22><s%> and widows, <S%G5503><s%> It is good <S%G2570><s%> for them if <S%G1437><s%> they abide <S%G3306><s%> even <S%G2504><s%> as I.
But if <S%G1487><s%> they cannot <S%G3756><s%> contain, <S%G1467><s%> let them marry: <S%G1060><s%> for it is better <S%G2909><s%> to marry <S%G1060><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> to burn. <S%G4448><s%>
And to the married <S%G1060><s%> I command, <S%G3853><s%> yet not I, but the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> Let not the wife <S%G1135><s%> depart <S%G5562><s%> from her husband: <S%G435><s%>

But and if <S%G1437><s%> she depart, <S%G5562><s%> let her remain <S%G3306><s%> unmarried <S%G22><s%>or <S%G2228><s%> be reconciled <S%G2644><s%> to her husband: <S%G435><s%> and let not the husband <S%G435><s%> put <S%G863><s%> away <S%G863><s%> his wife. <S%G1135><s%>

But to the rest <S%G3062><s%> speak <S%G3004><s%> I, not the Lord: <S%G2962><s%> If <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G1536><s%> brother <S%G80><s%> has <S%G2192><s%> a wife <S%G1135><s%> that believes <S%G571><s%> not, and she be pleased <S%G4909><s%> to dwell <S%G3611><s%> with him, let him not put <S%G863><s%> her away. <S%G863><s%>

And the woman <S%G1135><s%> which <S%G3748><s%> has <S%G2192><s%> an husband <S%G435><s%> that believes <S%G571><s%> not, and if he be pleased <S%G4909><s%> to dwell <S%G3611><s%> with her, let her not leave <S%G863><s%> him.

For the unbelieving <S%G571><s%> husband <S%G435><s%> is sanctified <S%G37><s%> by the wife, <S%G1135><s%> and the unbelieving <S%G571><s%> wife <S%G1135><s%> is sanctified <S%G37><s%> by the husband: <S%G435><s%> else <S%G1893><s%> <S%G686><s%> were your <S%G5216><s%> children <S%G5043><s%> unclean; <S%G169><s%> but now <S%G3568><s%> are they holy. <S%G40><s%>

But if <S%G1487><s%> the unbelieving <S%G571><s%> depart, <S%G5562><s%> let him depart. <S%G5562><s%> A brother <S%G80><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> a sister <S%G79><s%> is not under bondage <S%G1402><s%> in such <S%G5108><s%> cases: but God <S%G2316><s%> has called <S%G2564><s%> us to peace. <S%G1515><s%>

For what <S%G5101><s%> know <S%G1492><s%> you, O wife, <S%G1135><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> you shall save <S%G4982><s%> your husband? <S%G435><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> how <S%G5101><s%> know <S%G1492><s%> you, O man, <S%G435><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> you shall save <S%G4982><s%> your wife? <S%G1135><s%>

But as God <S%G2316><s%> has distributed <S%G3307><s%> to every <S%G1538><s%> man, as the Lord <S%G2962><s%> has called <S%G2564><s%> every <S%G1538><s%> one, so <S%G3779><s%> let him walk. <S%G4043><s%> And so <S%G3779><s%> ordain <S%G1299><s%> I in all <S%G3956><s%> churches. <S%G1577><s%>

Is any <S%G5100><s%> man called <S%G2564><s%> being circumcised? <S%G4059><s%> let him not become <S%G1986><s%> uncircumcised. <S%G1986><s%> Is any <S%G5100><s%> called <S%G2564><s%> in uncircumcision? <S%G203><s%> let him not be circumcised. <S%G4059><s%>
Circumcision <S%G4061><s%> is nothing, <S%G3762><s%> and uncircumcision <S%G203><s%> is nothing, <S%G3762><s%> but the keeping <S%G5084><s%> of the commandments <S%G1785><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>
Let every <S%G1538><s%> man abide <S%G3306><s%> in the same <S%G5026><s%> calling <S%G2821><s%> wherein <S%G1722><s%> <S%G3757><s%> he was called. <S%G2564><s%>

Are you called <S%G2564><s%> being a servant? <S%G1401><s%> care <S%G3199><s%> not for it: but if <S%G1499><s%> you may <S%G1410><s%> be made <S%G1096><s%> free, <S%G1658><s%> use <S%G5530><s%> it rather. <S%G3123><s%>

For he that is called <S%G2564><s%> in the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> being a servant, <S%G1401><s%> is the Lord's <S%G2962><s%> freeman: <S%G558><s%> likewise <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> he that is called, <S%G2564><s%> being free, <S%G1658><s%> is Christ's <S%G5547><s%> servant. <S%G1401><s%>
You are bought <S%G59><s%> with a price; <S%G5092><s%> be not you the servants <S%G1401><s%> of men. <S%G444><s%>
Brothers, <S%G80><s%> let every <S%G1538><s%> man, wherein <S%G1722><s%> <S%G3757><s%> he is called, <S%G2564><s%> therein <S%G1722><s%> <S%G5129><s%> abide <S%G3306><s%> with God. <S%G2316><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> virgins <S%G3933><s%> I have <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> commandment <S%G2003><s%> of the Lord: <S%G2962><s%> yet <S%G1161><s%> I give <S%G1325><s%> my judgment, <S%G1106><s%> as one that has obtained <S%G1653><s%> mercy <S%G1653><s%> of the Lord <S%G2962><s%> to be faithful. <S%G4103><s%>

I suppose <S%G3543><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> that this <S%G5124><s%> is good <S%G2570><s%> for the present <S%G1764><s%> distress, <S%G318><s%> I say, that it is good <S%G2570><s%> for a man <S%G444><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> to be.

Are you bound <S%G1210><s%> to a wife? <S%G1135><s%> seek <S%G2212><s%> not to be loosed. <S%G3089><s%> Are you loosed <S%G3080><s%> from a wife? <S%G1135><s%> seek <S%G2212><s%> not a wife. <S%G1135><s%>

But and if <S%G1437><s%> you marry, <S%G1060><s%> you have not sinned; <S%G264><s%> and if <S%G1437><s%> a virgin <S%G3933><s%> marry, <S%G1060><s%> she has not sinned. <S%G264><s%> Nevertheless <S%G1161><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> shall have <S%G2192><s%> trouble <S%G2347><s%> in the flesh: <S%G4561><s%> but I spare <S%G5339><s%> you.

But this <S%G5124><s%> I say, <S%G5346><s%> brothers, <S%G80><s%> the time <S%G2540><s%> is short: <S%G4958><s%> it remains, <S%G2076><s%> <S%G3063><s%> that both <S%G2532><s%> they that have <S%G2192><s%> wives <S%G1135><s%> be as though they had <S%G2192><s%> none; <S%G3361><s%>

And they that weep, <S%G2799><s%> as though they wept <S%G2799><s%> not; and they that rejoice, <S%G5463><s%> as though they rejoiced <S%G5463><s%> not; and they that buy, <S%G59><s%> as though they possessed <S%G2722><s%> not;

And they that use <S%G5530><s%> this <S%G5127><s%> world, <S%G2889><s%> as not abusing <S%G2710><s%> it: for the fashion <S%G4976><s%> of this <S%G5129><s%> world <S%G2889><s%> passes <S%G3855><s%> away.

But I would <S%G2309><s%> have you without <S%G275><s%> carefulness. <S%G275><s%> He that is unmarried <S%G22><s%> cares <S%G3309><s%> for the things that belong to the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> how <S%G4459><s%> he may please <S%G700><s%> the Lord: <S%G2962><s%>
But he that is married <S%G1060><s%> cares <S%G3309><s%> for the things that are of the world, <S%G2889><s%> how <S%G4459><s%> he may please <S%G700><s%> his wife. <S%G1135><s%>

There is difference <S%G3307><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> between <S%G3307><s%> a wife <S%G1135><s%> and a virgin. <S%G3933><s%> The unmarried <S%G22><s%> woman <S%G1135><s%> cares <S%G3309><s%> for the things of the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> that she may be holy <S%G40><s%> both <S%G2532><s%> in body <S%G4983><s%> and in spirit: <S%G4151><s%> but she that is married <S%G1060><s%> cares <S%G3309><s%> for the things of the world, <S%G2889><s%> how <S%G4459><s%> she may please <S%G700><s%> her husband. <S%G435><s%>

And this <S%G5124><s%> I speak <S%G3004><s%> for your <S%G5216><s%> own <S%G846><s%> profit; <S%G4851><s%> not that I may cast <S%G1911><s%> a snare <S%G1029><s%> on you, but for that which is comely, <S%G2158><s%> and that you may attend <S%G2145><s%> on the Lord <S%G2962><s%> without <S%G563><s%> distraction. <S%G563><s%>

But if <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> man think <S%G3543><s%> that he behaves <S%G807><s%> himself uncomely <S%G807><s%> toward <S%G1909><s%> his virgin, <S%G3933><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> she pass <S%G5230><s%> the flower <S%G5230><s%> of her age, <S%G5230><s%> and need <S%G3784><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> require, <S%G1096><s%> let him do <S%G4160><s%> what <S%G3739><s%> he will, <S%G2309><s%> he sins <S%G264><s%> not: let them marry. <S%G1060><s%>

Nevertheless <S%G1161><s%> he that stands <S%G2476><s%> steadfast <S%G1476><s%> in his heart, <S%G2588><s%> having <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> necessity, <S%G318><s%> but has <S%G2192><s%> power <S%G1849><s%> over <S%G4012><s%> his own <S%G2398><s%> will, <S%G2307><s%> and has so <S%G5124><s%> decreed <S%G2919><s%> in his heart <S%G2588><s%> that he will keep <S%G5083><s%> his virgin, <S%G3933><s%> does <S%G4160><s%> well. <S%G2573><s%>

So <S%G5620><s%> then <S%G2532><s%> he that gives her in marriage <S%G1547><s%> does <S%G4160><s%> well; <S%G2573><s%> but he that gives her not in marriage <S%G1547><s%> does <S%G4160><s%> better. <S%G2573><s%>

The wife <S%G1135><s%> is bound <S%G1210><s%> by the law <S%G3551><s%> as long <S%G5550><s%> as her husband <S%G435><s%> lives; <S%G2198><s%> but if <S%G1437><s%> her husband <S%G435><s%> be dead, <S%G2837><s%> she is at <S%G1657><s%> liberty <S%G1658><s%> to be married <S%G1060><s%> to whom <S%G3739><s%> she will; <S%G2309><s%> only <S%G3440><s%> in the Lord. <S%G2962><s%>

But she is happier <S%G3107><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> she so <S%G3779><s%> abide, <S%G3306><s%> after <S%G2596><s%> my judgment: <S%G1106><s%> and I think <S%G1380><s%> also <S%G2504><s%> that I have <S%G2192><s%> the Spirit <S%G4151><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>
